description.en_US: Throw out a flaming punch that pierces through a small group of enemies in front of you.
Twirl forward and perform a double lariat, barraging nearby enemies in fire.
Project a raging inferno from your fist before sending caught enemies flying with an uppercut. Damage dealt increases the closer foes are.
Twirl in a slightly adjustable path, dragging enemies into a flame vortex before an explosive finish.
Surrounded in raging cosmic flames, pummel enemies with a series of jabs before sending enemies into the stars with a grand uppercut.
Twirl around in a flame vortex that slowly amasses a raging ball of fire, before letting it explode in a grand finish.
Dash through your enemies while leaving a short trail of fire.
Punch through your enemies like a mirage before setting off a delayed blast on the first enemy hit.
Dash through your enemies while leaving a searing barrage of fire blasts behind.
Punch through your enemies in a scorching mirage before setting off delayed blasts on up to three hit enemies.
Assault enemies with a series of blazing punches before immolating them in lingering hellfire.
Launch forth a rocket-propelled mechanical fist that explodes on contact.
Launch forth five rocket-propelled mechanical fists that home in on enemies and explode on contact.
Perfect guard an attack and counter with a flaming shield launch.
Unleashes the user's passions within, creating two protective flames that block projectiles at the cost of defense.
Perfect guard an attack and counter with a rocketing shield that drags enemies away.
Unleashes the user's desire to fight danger head on, creating three protective flames that reflect projectiles at the cost of defense.
The vibrant flare of the rainbow spares no evil. Conjure five divine flames that shield the user from projectile attacks and rain a gauntlet of fists on attackers, all at the cost of defense.
Perfect guard an attack and counter with a devastating barrage of rocketing shields that pummel nearby enemies before finishing off with a rocket punch.
